The game was an instant buy for me back when it got released and I can't believe I hadn't written a review about it. Well pardon me, maybe because I was so engrossed in the game that I forgot.

It ran beautifully. The scares were amazing, the gameplay is amazing and new contents keep coming up (still waiting for chucky the killer doll, plz dbd :D) and of course there were the funny game breaking bugs that didn't stop me from playing.

But unfortunately, it happened. I played this game mainly to duo with a friend but then problems started to happen after hours and hours. We couldn't play together anymore. There was a bug preventing us. This happened for weeks until we just stopped. Then I focused on playing killer and that also came to a halt when it took 10-15 minutes to fill a lobby or sometimes even never.

Came back a few weeks ago and everything's fine <3 and hopefully it stays fine for a long while.
This game is broken Don't try this game

After 750+ hours of game time since launch I just can't recommend this game in its current state. It has become a shadow of what it used to be due to developers who constantly nurf survivor perks and mechanics in an attempt to achieve greater "balance" despite the statistics showing an average of a little under 40% escape rate between ranks 1 to 5 when they were last shown (likely even lower now). It's borderline unplayable with more future plans which please the 20% minority of killer players at the expense of the 80% majority of survivor players.

Friday the 13th: The Game is a survival horror video game formerly developed by IllFonic, and published by Gun Media. It is based on the film franchise of the same name. It was released on May 26, 2017 as a digital release and later released on October 13, 2017 as a physical release for PlayStation 4, and Xbox One.

What can I say about Dead by Daylight? I don't usually like horror games, but this isn't your typical "just jumpscare, escape the AI" type of horror game. The stories for each character really get you into their thoughts and feelings, and you can customize each character you play based on your playstyle. Leveling up your survivor or killer is incredibly simple and can be rewarding. The game runs incredibly smoothly, at least on my computer, and has very eerie audio which makes you constantly on the edge of your seat. Usually you can find a lobby rather quickly to play with other people, which is really nice, and the community seems really friendly at least to me! 
Overall, great purchase!
Edit: After a long time of playing the game, it takes an incredibly long time, at least for me, to find a lobby when playing the Killer, which turns me off from playing that side. There are also A LOT of connection issues to different lobbies when trying to find a game. However, when you do find a game, it is insanely fun! :D

DO NOT GET THIS GAME.

Seriously it looks fun and all from the surface but it isn't once you get into it a little bit.

Main issue. Game Balance. The game really fovours survivors. Sure early on you might suffer against some hunters, but after you have all the meta perks and all that fun shit, its just GG. You can youtube plenty of videos of people pointing this stuff out. Once you start climing the ladder, you will run into players with all the meta skills maxed, and destroy you as the killer.

Second issue. The grind. Seriously to even compete against these people you have to buy some DLC to level those hunters so you can get them on the hunters you want to actually use (Or once a week you might get lucky and have the skill show up that you can buy with shards.) But doing this of course just adds to the already insane grind you need to do.

Ranking sucks in this early age as well. You play as a killer for about 3-4 hours and you are easily in rank 15. (20 is lowest. 1 is highest.) In this rank you will start seeing higher rank players that are 10 ranks off from you, maxed skills that just destroy you. You have no control of the situation as the killer. Survivors do.

The devs them selves suck at balancing, seeming to stick to balancing around rank 20 players. The people that suck and don't know what they are doing as survivors. People that are of course not good to use as a means to establish balance.

As I said, watch youtube videos. There are people with much more knowledge and experience that can explain just the real issue with this. 

If this gets fixed and balanced, then sure, but for now, don't. It will just be a waste of time and disappointment if you want to play a killer.

When I was buying this game I had no idea how much I'll get to like it. It provides a really unique experience that no other game provided me. Playing as a survivor is a lot different compared to playing as a killer, therefore it's like two games in one. Dead By Daylight is far more complex than it originally looks like, and your survival depends on your luck, planning, reflexes and outwitting the killer. The game obviously isn't perfect, but the developers really keep themselves invested, constantly working out the balance as well as providing with new content. I believe the game is worth recommending, especially if bought on a sale.
